## Population analysis. Data is as follows - c1: sample, c2: genotype, c3: ORMDL3 expression (I'm assuming)
```{r}
data<-read.delim("https://bioboot.github.io/bggn213_W19/class-material/rs8067378_ENSG00000172057.6.txt",sep = "", header = TRUE)
```
summary stats determine sample size for each genotype and their corresponding median expression levels for each of these genotypes.
```{r}

geno1<-data[data$geno=="A/A",]
geno2<-data[data$geno=="A/G",]
geno3<-data[data$geno=="G/G",]

nrow(geno1)
median(geno1$exp)

nrow(geno2)
median(geno2$exp)

nrow(geno3)
median(geno3$exp)

```
Answers:

A/A: sample size = 108, median expression = 31.24847
A/G: sample size = 233, median expression = 25.06486
G/G: sample size = 121, median expression = 20.07363

boxplot
```{r}
boxplot(exp~geno,data)
```

calculating significance of difference between A/A and G/G
```{r}
t<-t.test(geno1$exp,geno3$exp)
t$p.value

```
